docs.lead_paragraph: A standard feature of disability insurance policies -- the two-year limit on payments for disability resulting from mental illness -- has been challenged in a lawsuit filed in a Federal court in Manhattan. The lawsuit involves an employee of the Israel Discount Bank of New York, identified only as "Leonard F.," who is said to suffer chronic depression. According to the suit, he has about one year of disability benefits remaining but his condition is expected to last far longer.

headline.main: Suit Over Benefits for Mental Disability
